questionListItems.title: My child has been offered a place in DSA, does she still need to make an option for the Sec schools?

answer.body:
If your child has been confirmed a place in DSA or given a waitlist in DSA at the DSA Sec exercise, and is posted to MGS, she will not be given an option form to select secondary schools.

However, she needs to complete her registration to her posted secondary school. Please check school websites for registration details.

questionListItems.title: Must my child’s PSLE Score fall within a specific range even if she receives a Confirmed/Wait List Offer from your school?

answer.body:
DSA applicant who has a PSLE score from AL 4 to 22 would qualify to be posted to MGS since she is eligible for Posting Group 3 (which is equivalent to the Express stream).


Access the MOE Full Subject-Based Banding (SSB) site and click on the ""From 2024 onwards"" tab to find out more about Posting Group 3 (PG3).

questionListItems.title: Why is IPad selected as the PLD for my child/ward?

answer.body:
The reasons for the choice of iPads as PLD include the superior touch interfaces offered by iPads, which greatly enhance the learning experience compared to the limitations of Chromebooks.


With iPads, students will have access to a more engaging and dynamic learning environment. The iPad's touch interface is not only responsive to finger gestures but also supports the use of a stylus, such as the highly responsive Apple Pencil. This combination opens up new possibilities for students, allowing them to explore more flexible and varied learning experiences.


Moreover, iPads have proven to be durable devices, capable of withstanding the demands of everyday student use. Additionally, their Operating System remains robust and continually evolves to stay relevant over time. This ensures that students will have access to the latest educational tools and resources, keeping pace with the ever-changing technological landscape.


By transitioning to iPads, we aim to provide our students with an enriched learning experience that harnesses the full potential of touch interfaces, stylus input, and a reliable and adaptive operating system.

questionListItems.title: Can my child drop out of the MEP programme if she finds that she cannot cope with it later?

answer.body:
ALL MEP STUDENTS MUST UNDERSTAND THAT THE COMMITMENT IS FOR FOUR YEARS.


Withdrawal is only allowed with valid reasons e.g., consistently failing MEP or weak in all subjects, including MEP, on case by case basis.

questionListItems.title: What if my child/ward loses her belongings in school?

answer.body: Your child may approach the General Office (GO) to check if their lost item(s) have been handed over to the GO. For item with identification, the GO will contact the student through her Form Teacher so that she can claim her belongings from the GO.

questionListItems.title: How many students are there in Secondary One Classes?
I received more than one DSA offer. When must I decide which to accept?

answer.body: You will have to indicate your preferences in ranked order for up to three schools during the School Preference Stage in late October after PSLE.

questionListItems.title: What is the indicative AL score range for MGS?

answer.body:
The indicative AL Score ranges of Methodist Girls’ School (Sec) can be found on this MOE SchoolFinder record for MGS.

Note that admission into the IP course in MGS-Sec is based purely on merit. There is no affiliation requirement.

Click here for more information on supporting your child in making informed school choices.

questionListItems.title: My family is planning to migrate. How do I proceed to withdraw my child/ward from MGS?

answer.body: You may write in to inform your child's Form Teachers. The school will get in touch with you on the processes accordingly.

questionListItems.title: What happens if my child/ward feels unwell during a lesson?

answer.body:
Your child should inform her teacher immediately before proceeding to the General Office (GO). GO staff will provide basic first aid and she will stay in the sick bay if necessary.


For student needing immediate medical care (e.g. high fever), GO staff will inform parent to fetch your child from the school soonest possible to seek medical assistance.

questionListItems.title: My child/ward was injured during PE in school. How do I go about to submit an insurance claim?

answer.body: Our students are covered with Group Personal Accident (GPA) with NTUC Income. You may submit your claim with the insurance company here.

questionListItems.title: What should I do if my PLD is damaged?

answer.body: For PLD bought through our school, it will be covered with 3 years warranty. Please view the details at our PLD information kit.
